filmography.title: Days of Glory
filmography.role_description: A charismatic Russian partisan leader during WWII who commands a group of guerrillas fighting against the Nazi invasion.
filmography.plot: A group of Soviet guerrillas fight back against the Nazi invasion of Russia in 1941.

filmography.title: The Keys of the Kingdom
filmography.role_description: A humble and unconventional Scottish priest who spends decades establishing a mission in China, facing war, poverty, and prejudice.
filmography.plot: A Scottish priest establishes a mission in China and struggles through decades of hardship, war, and cultural clashes.

filmography.title: The Valley of Decision
filmography.role_description: The son of a steel mill owner who falls in love with the family's Irish maid, causing tension amidst labor strikes and class divides.
filmography.plot: An Irish housemaid romances the son of a steel mill owner in 19th-century Pittsburgh.

filmography.title: Spellbound
filmography.role_description: An amnesiac posing as the new head of a mental hospital who must unlock his suppressed memories to prove his innocence in a murder.
filmography.plot: A psychiatrist protects the identity of an amnesia patient accused of murder while attempting to recover his memory.

filmography.title: The Yearling
filmography.role_description: A warm and understanding father in post-Civil War Florida who supports his son's attachment to a pet deer despite the harsh realities of farm life.
filmography.plot: A boy persuades his parents to allow him to adopt a young deer, but the animal's growth causes problems for the family's crops.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actor; Golden Globe: Win – Best Actor (Drama)

filmography.title: Duel in the Sun
filmography.role_description: A reckless, charming, and morally corrupt cowboy who engages in a passionate and destructive love affair with a half-Native American woman.
filmography.plot: A beautiful half-Native American woman goes to live with her white relatives and becomes the object of a feud between two brothers.

filmography.title: Gentleman's Agreement
filmography.role_description: A widowed journalist who poses as a Jewish man to write an exposé on anti-Semitism in New York City and affluent suburbs.
filmography.plot: A reporter pretends to be Jewish in order to cover a story on anti-Semitism, and personally discovers the true depths of bigotry and hatred.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actor; Oscar: Win – Best Picture

filmography.title: The Paradine Case
filmography.role_description: A successful British barrister who risks his marriage and reputation when he falls in love with the seductive client he is defending against a murder charge.
filmography.plot: A happily married lawyer falls in love with the woman he is defending against a murder charge.

filmography.title: Yellow Sky
filmography.role_description: An outlaw leader who takes his gang into a ghost town, only to be challenged by the tough woman living there and his own moral compass.
filmography.plot: A band of bank robbers on the run from the law wind up in a ghost town, where they terrorize an old man and his granddaughter.

filmography.title: Twelve O'Clock High
filmography.role_description: A tough-as-nails Air Force commander who takes over a struggling bomber unit, pushing them to their limits while nearly breaking under the pressure himself.
filmography.plot: A hard-as-nails general takes over a bomber unit suffering from low morale and whips them into fighting shape.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actor; NYFCC: Win – Best Actor

filmography.title: The Gunfighter
filmography.role_description: A weary, legendary gunslinger who desperately wants to retire and see his family but cannot escape his reputation and the young punks looking to make a name for themselves.
filmography.plot: A notorious gunslinger is challenged by a young gunfighter who wants to make a name for himself.

filmography.title: Captain Horatio Hornblower
filmography.role_description: A brilliant and courageous British naval officer during the Napoleonic Wars who battles enemy ships and navigates complex diplomatic situations.
filmography.plot: During the Napoleonic wars, a British naval captain has adventures in Central American waters.

filmography.title: The Snows of Kilimanjaro
filmography.role_description: A writer lying injured on an African safari who reflects on his failures in life and love while facing death from gangrene.
filmography.plot: Writer Harry Street reflects on his life as he lies dying from an infection while on safari in the shadow of Mount Kilimanjaro.

filmography.title: Roman Holiday
filmography.role_description: A cynical American reporter in Rome who plans to exploit a runaway princess for a story but ends up falling in love with her.
filmography.plot: A bored and sheltered princess escapes her guardians and falls in love with an American newsman in Rome.

filmography.title: The Million Pound Note
filmography.role_description: A penniless American sailor in London who becomes the subject of a bet involving a single banknote worth one million pounds.
filmography.plot: Two wealthy brothers make a bet: if they give a destitute man a one million pound note, will he be able to survive without spending it?

filmography.title: Moby Dick
filmography.role_description: The fanatical and obsessed captain of the Pequod who leads his crew on a doomed quest to kill the white whale that took his leg.
filmography.plot: The sole survivor of a lost whaling ship relates the tale of his captain's self-destructive obsession to hunt the white whale, Moby Dick.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Win – Best Director (John Huston)

filmography.title: The Man in the Gray Flannel Suit
filmography.role_description: A WWII veteran struggling to balance his corporate career with his family life while haunted by memories of his war service.
filmography.plot: An ex-soldier faces ethical questions as he tries to earn enough to support his wife and children.

filmography.title: Designing Woman
filmography.role_description: A gruff sportswriter whose marriage to a sophisticated fashion designer is tested by their clashing lifestyles and ex-lovers.
filmography.plot: A sportswriter and a fashion designer marry after a whirlwind romance, but their different lifestyles and friends cause friction.

filmography.title: The Big Country
filmography.role_description: A retired sea captain who travels West to marry but refuses to conform to the violent code of the frontier, seeking a peaceful resolution to a range war.
filmography.plot: A New Englander arrives in the Old West, where he becomes embroiled in a feud between two families over a valuable patch of land.

filmography.title: The Bravados
filmography.role_description: A rancher who relentlessly hunts down four outlaws he believes raped and murdered his wife, only to discover a terrible truth.
filmography.plot: A rancher hunts down the four outlaws who killed his wife, but discovers that his quest for vengeance has a heavy price.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Win – Best Supporting Actor (Albert Salmi)

filmography.title: On the Beach
filmography.role_description: A submarine commander who brings his crew to Australia, the last refuge from a nuclear apocalypse, and finds love while awaiting the inevitable end.
filmography.plot: After a global nuclear war, the residents of Australia must come to terms with the fact that all life will be destroyed in a matter of months.

filmography.title: The Guns of Navarone
filmography.role_description: A renowned mountaineer and British officer who leads an elite commando team on a desperate mission to destroy massive German artillery guns.
filmography.plot: A British team is sent to cross occupied Greek territory and destroy the massive German gun emplacement that commands a key sea channel.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Motion Picture (Drama)

filmography.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
filmography.role_description: A widowed lawyer in Depression-era Alabama who defends a Black man falsely accused of rape, serving as a pillar of integrity and morality for his children and community.
filmography.plot: Atticus Finch, a lawyer in the Depression-era South, defends a black man against an undeserved rape charge, and his children against prejudice.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Actor; Golden Globe: Win – Best Actor (Drama)

filmography.title: Cape Fear
filmography.role_description: A straight-arrow lawyer whose family is stalked and terrorized by a sadistic criminal he helped send to prison years earlier.
filmography.plot: A lawyer and his family are stalked by a man he helped send to jail.

filmography.title: Captain Newman, M.D.
filmography.role_description: A compassionate army psychiatrist running a neuropsychiatric ward during WWII who clashes with military bureaucracy to help his traumatized patients.
filmography.plot: During World War II, a captain in the Medical Corps runs the psychiatric ward of an Army Air Corps hospital.

filmography.title: Mirage
filmography.role_description: A cost accountant who loses his memory during a power blackout and becomes the target of mysterious killers.
filmography.plot: A man suffering from amnesia is pursued by mysterious men who want him dead, and he doesn't know why.

filmography.title: Arabesque
filmography.role_description: An American university professor who is dragged into international espionage and a chase across London involving a hieroglyphic cipher.
filmography.plot: A university professor of ancient languages discovers a secret message and gets involved in international espionage.

filmography.title: The Omen
filmography.role_description: An American diplomat who adopts an orphan after his own son dies at birth, only to slowly realize the child may be the Antichrist.
filmography.plot: Mysterious deaths surround an American ambassador. Could the child that he is raising actually be the Antichrist?

filmography.title: MacArthur
filmography.role_description: The controversial and larger-than-life American general, portraying his campaigns in WWII and the Korean War up to his dismissal.
filmography.plot: A biography of the famous/infamous General Douglas MacArthur, who was the Supreme Allied Commander in the South West Pacific during WWII.

filmography.title: The Boys from Brazil
filmography.role_description: The infamous Nazi doctor living in hiding in South America who orchestrates a sinister plot to clone Adolf Hitler.
filmography.plot: A Nazi hunter in Paraguay discovers a plot to rekindle the Third Reich involving the cloning of Adolf Hitler.

filmography.title: Old Gringo
filmography.role_description: The cynical, aging American writer who travels to Mexico to die during the revolution, finding one last adventure.
filmography.plot: When American schoolteacher Harriet Winslow arrives in Mexico to teach on a hacienda, she finds herself caught up in the Mexican Revolution.
